title: Introduction to Computer Programming (with Java, for Beginners
description: Introduction to Computer Programming is the first course in our series introducing students to computer science. In this class you will learn the fundamentals of computer programming in Java, with emphasis on applications in science and engineering. You will also learn about the broader field of computer science and algorithmic thinking, the fundamental approach that computer scientists take to solving problems.

title: Programming Languages and Techniques I
description: A fast-paced introduction to the fundamental concepts of programming and software design. This course assumes some previous programming experience, at the level of a high school computer science class or CIS110. No specific programming language background is assumed: basic experience with any language is fine.

title: Programming Languages and Techniques II
description: This is a course about Algorithms and Data Structures using the Java programming language. The course builds upon existing implementations of basic data structures in Java and extends them for the structures like trees, studying their efficiency when used in real-world applications.

title: Technology and Policy
description: This course focuses on developing an understanding of existing and emerging technologies, along with the political, societal and economic impacts of those technologies.

title: Introduction to Cognitive Science
description: How do minds work? This course surveys answers to this question from disciplines ranging from philosophy to neuroscience, with attention to computational models.

title: Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science
description: This course provides an introduction to proof principles, logics, functions and relations, induction principles, combinatorics and graph theory, as well as reading mathematical proofs.

title: C++ Programming
description: This course will provide an introduction to programming in C++ and is intended for students who already have some exposure to programming in another language.

title: Using and Understanding Unix and Linux
description: This course provides a thorough introduction to Unix and Linux. Topics will range from critical basic skills such as examining and editing files to writing shell scripts.

title: Python Programming
description: This course will provide an introduction to the Python programming language, covering scripting, systems programming, research tools, and web development.

title: C# Programming
description: This course provides a thorough introduction to the C# language and the .NET framework, focusing on object-oriented design and application development.

title: Haskell Programming
description: Haskell is a high-level, purely functional programming language. The course explores functional programming and Haskell as a vehicle for writing practical programs.

title: Mobile App Development
description: This project-oriented course is centered around application development on mobile platforms like iOS and Android. Topics include app lifecycles, storyboarding, and APIs.

title: Ruby on Rails Web Development
description: This course will teach the fundamentals of developing web applications using Ruby on Rails, a rapid-development web framework developed by 37signals.

title: JavaScript
description: This course provides an introduction to modern web development frameworks, techniques, and practices used to deliver robust client side applications on the web.

title: Rust Programming
description: This course will cover Rust as a practical alternative to C and C++ for systems programming. Topics include Rust type system, memory management, concurrency, and web applications.
prereqs: CIS 120 or exposure to functional programming
CIS 240 (or exposure to C or C++)

title: Introduction to Computer Architecture
description: This course is a broad introduction to all aspects of computer systems architecture and serves as the foundation for subsequent computer systems courses.

title: Discrete Probability, Stochastic Processes, and Statistical Inference
description: This course provides an integrated approach to theory and applications of discrete probability, stochastic processes, and statistical inference.

title: Automata, Computability, and Complexity
description: This course explores questions fundamental to computer science such as which problems can and cannot be solved by computers, and the computational complexity of these problems.

title: Introduction to Algorithms
description: This course provides a comprehensive introduction to design and analysis of algorithms, covering advanced data structures and techniques like dynamic programming.

title: Intro to Networks and Security
description: This course introduces principles and practices of computer and network security. Topics include cryptography, network protocols, and software security.

title: Advanced Topics in Algorithms
description: This course focuses on general techniques for designing randomized algorithms and their applications, including approximation algorithms, cryptography, and data structures.

title: Compilers and Interpreters
description: In CIS341 you'll learn how to build a compiler. Topics covered include lexical analysis, grammars, parsing, intermediate representations, and code generation.

title: Software Design/Engineering
description: This course introduces students to tools and processes used by professionals in software engineering, including agile development, testing, refactoring, and source control.

title: Computer Organization and Design
description: This course focuses on computer hardware design. Topics include digital system design, instruction set design, assembly programming, and different forms of parallelism.

title: Computer Operating Systems
description: This course surveys methods and algorithms used in modern operating systems. Topics include process synchronization, virtual memory, and distributed operation.

title: Robotics: Planning and Perception
description: This course introduces basic principles of robotics with an emphasis on computer science aspects. Topics include planning algorithms and perception.

title: Quantum Computer and Information Science
description: This course introduces students to quantum computers and quantum information science. No prior knowledge of quantum mechanics is assumed.

title: Senior Project
description: Design and implementation of a significant piece of work: software, hardware or theory. Emphasis on technical writing and oral communication skills.
prereqs: Senior standing or permission of instructor

title: Senior Project (Continuation)
description: Continuation of CIS 400. Students are required to submit a final written report and give a final presentation and demonstration of their project.
prereqs: Senior standing or permission of instructor

title: Applied Machine Learning
description: This course introduces the fundamental concepts and algorithms of machine learning, with a focus on supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning.

title: Artificial Intelligence
description: This course investigates algorithms to implement knowledge-based agents which sense and act in the world. Topics include search, machine learning, and natural language processing.

title: Introduction to Computational Biology and Biological Modeling
description: The course will develop a deeper understanding of techniques used in Computational Biology. Topics include algorithm design, statistical data analysis, and theory of algorithms.

title: Embedded Software for Life-Critical Applications
description: This course provides experience in embedded software development, with a focus on modeling, design, verification, and validation of safety critical systems.

title: Database and Information Systems
description: This course covers database and information systems, including data modeling, relational and XML data design, query languages, and data storage.

title: Internet and Web Systems
description: This course focuses on the challenges of building Internet and web systems: scalability, interoperability, security, and fault tolerance. The course includes a project to implement a peer-to-peer search engine.

title: Interactive Computer Graphics
description: This course focuses on programming the essential mathematical and geometric concepts underlying modern computer graphics, including mesh data structures, rendering algorithms, and animation.

title: Advanced Rendering
description: This course provides a comprehensive overview of computer graphics techniques in 3D modeling, image synthesis, and rendering. Topics include ray tracing, radiosity, and global illumination.

title: Computer Animation
description: This course covers core subject matter common to the fields of robotics, character animation, and embodied intelligent agents. Topics include coordinate systems, kinematics, and dynamic systems.

title: Logic in Computer Science
description: This course provides a thorough introduction to mathematical logic, covering in-depth topics of syntax, semantics, decision procedures, and soundness and completeness for both propositional and first-order logic.

title: Senior Project (DMD Students only)
description: The goal of this course is to provide an opportunity for DMD seniors to define, design, and execute a project that demonstrates the technical skills and abilities they have acquired during their studies.
prereqs: Senior standing or permission of instructor
